info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 3:57PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN KENTON, NORTHERN CAMPBELL, HAMILTON, BUTLER, CLERMONT, WEST CENTRAL BROWN AND WESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EST... At 355 PM EST, snow showers were located along a line extending from near Kings Island to near Ross, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Rapidly reduced visibility and an inch of snow per hour of accumulation is expected with this area of snow. SOURCE...Butler County emergency management. IMPACT...Driving conditions will be negatively impacted, particularly due to the reduction of visibility. Slick roads are also possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Covington, Mason, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Springboro, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Franklin, Springdale and Reading. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 32. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 188 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 35.
info.instruction: Exercise extra caution while traveling. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
